definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

pinyin: qie2 er4 shi2 ba1 xing1 piao2 chong2

sentences.chinese: 这个瓢虫是什么颜色的？

sentences.english: A ladybug can retract its head into its body.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫可以将自己的头缩回到躯体中去。

sentences.english: It is the Lady Bug and Beetle Kingdoms that address you today.
sentences.chinese: 今天瓢虫王国和甲虫王国向你问候。

sentences.english: The survival curves fell into Deevey I.
sentences.chinese: 多异瓢虫的存活曲线均为I型。

sentences.english: They are other names for what most of us call the ladybug .
sentences.chinese: 这些是我们大部分人叫做瓢虫的东西的别称。

sentences.english: As ladybugs age, the color of their spots fades.
sentences.chinese: 随着瓢虫年龄的增长他们身上的色彩和图案逐渐褪色。

sentences.english: In its lifetime, a female ladybug will lay as many as 2, 000 eggs.
sentences.chinese: 在雌性瓢虫的一生中将产下多达2000枚的卵。

sentences.english: However, I particularly like my little ladybug lantern.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我还是特别喜欢我的小瓢虫花灯。

sentences.english: Ladybugs are most active from spring untill fall.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫活跃于春季至秋季。

sentences.english: There were ants, lacewings, ladybirds, and beetles.
sentences.chinese: 里面有蚂蚁，草蜻蛉，瓢虫，和甲虫。

sentences.english: Most ladybugs have oval, domeshaped bodies with six short legs.
sentences.chinese: 多数瓢虫有椭圆形盖装的躯体和六只腿。

sentences.english: A ladybug in flight beats its wings up to 85 times per second.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫飞行时每秒钟扇动翅膀85次。

sentences.english: The predation and spatial heterogeneity on Harmonia axyridis adult to Myzus persicae were determined.
sentences.chinese: 测定异色瓢虫成虫对桃蚜的捕食功能和空间异质性。

sentences.english: The pests go away, but the ladybirds do not.
sentences.chinese: 害虫离开了，但是瓢虫没有。

sentences.english: In the United States there are 17 species of ladybugs.
Coccinellids had the longest temporal niche in wheat fields in both Tacheng and Ili.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫类在塔城和伊犁小麦田的时间生态位宽度均较长。
